net.kuujo.vertigo.feeder

Interface Feeder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component<Feeder>

    public interface Feeder
extends Component<Feeder>
    A message feeder. Feeders are tasked with feeding messages from a data source to a network. When data is emitted from a feeder, the data will be transformed into a message and tagged with a unique identifier. This identifier is used to track the message and its descendents throughout the network. Once the message and all of its descendants have been fully processed (acked), the feeder may optionally be notified via asynchronous result handlers.
    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

      • getMaxQueueSize

long getMaxQueueSize()
        Deprecated. 
        Gets the maximum feed queue size. Use the getFeedQueueMaxSize method.
        Returns:
        The maximum queue size allowed for the feeder.

      • setFeedQueueMaxSize

        Feeder setFeedQueueMaxSize(long maxSize)
        Sets the maximum feed queue size. The feeder uses an underlying queue to track which messages have been emitted from the component but not yet acked. This indicates how many messages may reside in the queue (in memory) at any given time.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum queue size allowed for the feeder.
        Returns:
        The called feeder instance.

      • getFeedQueueMaxSize

        long getFeedQueueMaxSize()
        Gets the maximum feed queue size. The feeder uses an underlying queue to track which messages have been emitted from the component but not yet acked. This indicates how many messages may reside in the queue (in memory) at any given time.
        Returns:
        The maximum queue size allowed for the feeder.

      • queueFull

        @Deprecated
boolean queueFull()
        Deprecated. 
        Indicates whether the feed queue is full. Use the feedQueueFull method.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether the feed queue is full.

      • feedQueueFull

        boolean feedQueueFull()
        Indicates whether the feed queue is full. Depending on the feeder implementation, this method may be used to check whether the feed queue is full prior to feeding additional data to a network.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether the feed queue is full.

      • setAutoRetry

        Feeder setAutoRetry(boolean retry)
        Sets the feeder auto-retry option. If this option is enabled, the feeder will automatically retry sending timed out messages. Note that this means that asynchronous ack handlers will not be called since the feeder will automatically retry sending those timed out messages. Failed messages will still trigger the ack handler.
        Parameters:
        retry - Indicates whether to automatically retry emitting timed out data.
        Returns:
        The called feeder instance.

      • isAutoRetry

        boolean isAutoRetry()
        Gets the feeder auto-retry option. If this option is enabled, the feeder will automatically retry sending timed out messages.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether the feeder with automatically retry emitting timed out data.

      • setRetryAttempts

        @Deprecated
Feeder setRetryAttempts(int attempts)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the number of automatic retry attempts for a single timed out message. Use the setAutoRetryAttempts method.
        Parameters:
        attempts - The number of retry attempts allowed. If attempts is -1 then an infinite number of retry attempts will be allowed.
        Returns:
        The called feeder instance.

      • setFeedInterval

        Feeder setFeedInterval(long interval)
        Sets the feed interval. The feed interval indicates the interval at which the feeder will attempt to poll the feed handler for new data.
        Parameters:
        interval - The empty feed interval.
        Returns:
        The called feeder instance.
        See Also:
        feedHandler(Handler) feedHandler}

      • getFeedInterval

        long getFeedInterval()
        Gets the feed interval. The feed interval indicates the interval at which the feeder will attempt to poll the feed handler for new data.
        Returns:
        The empty feed interval.
        See Also:
        feedHandler(Handler) feedHandler}

      • feedHandler

        Feeder feedHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Feeder> handler)
        Sets a feed handler. The feed handler will be periodically polled for new data. Each time the feed handler is polled only a single message should be emitted. This allows the feeder to maintain control over the flow of data. If the feed handler is called but fails to feed any new messages to the network, the feeder will reschedule the next call to the handler for a period in the near future.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be invoked for feeding data to the network.
        Returns:
        The called feeder instance.

      • drainHandler

        Feeder drainHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Void> handler)
        Sets a drain handler on the feeder. The drain handler will be called when the feed queue is available to receive new messages.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be invoked when a full feed queue is emptied.
        Returns:
        The called feeder instance.

      • emit

        MessageId emit(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body)
        Emits a message to the default stream.
        Parameters:
        body - The message body.
        Returns:
        The emitted message identifier.

      • emit

        MessageId emit(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body,
             org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<MessageId>> ackHandler)
        Emits a message to the default stream with an ack handler.
        Parameters:
        body - The message body.
        ackHandler - An asynchronous result handler to be called once the emitted message has been fully processed. This AsyncResult implementation is a special implementation that will *always* contain the MessageId regardless of whether the message was successfully processed or not. If the message was not successfully processed, the cause of the failure will be either a FailureException or a TimeoutException. If auto retries are enabled on the feeder then the ack handler will not be called for timed out messages (unless the maximum number of automatic retries has been reached).
        Returns:
        The emitted message identifier.

      • emit

        MessageId emit(String stream,
             org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body)
        Emits a message to a non-default stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream to which to emit the data.
        body - The message body.
        Returns:
        The emitted message identifier.

      • emit

        MessageId emit(String stream,
             org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject body,
             org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<MessageId>> ackHandler)
        Emits a message to a non-default stream with an ack handler.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream to which to emit the data.
        body - The message body.
        ackHandler - An asynchronous result handler to be called once the emitted message has been fully processed. This AsyncResult implementation is a special implementation that will *always* contain the MessageId regardless of whether the message was successfully processed or not. If the message was not successfully processed, the cause of the failure will be either a FailureException or a TimeoutException. If auto retries are enabled on the feeder then the ack handler will not be called for timed out messages (unless the maximum number of automatic retries has been reached).
        Returns:
        The emitted message identifier.
